*[Bug 18955] cairo library update 1.16 -> 1.18 seems to break font embedding into PDF (R 4.3 -> 4.4 transition)*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18955>

--- Comment #16 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
I've modified R-devel to use the cairo win32 font backend on Windows with cairo
> 1.16. With that, the ggplot2 example above works, the font is found and
embedded correctly. If anyone sees a problem with this, please let me know.

This work-around is in R, so it affects only graphics produced by R, not by
package Cairo. If this is confirmed upstream as a cairo bug and fixed, we can
remove this work-around (even though in spirit of the cairo documentation, it
is probably better to use a specific font backend rather than the toy interface
to select fonts) and instead port such cairo fix to Rtools.
